docs.snippet: Matt Shoemaker held Japan to two hits in five scoreless innings as the M.L.B. All-Stars won the final two games of the series after losing the first three....
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Shoemaker held Japan to two hits in five scoreless innings as the M.L.B. All-Stars won the final two games of the series after losing the first three.
docs.abstract: MLB All-Stars beat Japan, 3-1, in final game of five-game series; Japan wins series, 3-2.

docs.snippet: Citi Field renovation No. 2, unveiled on Tuesday and limited to right-center field, should give a boost to hitters like David Wright, Lucas Duda and Curtis Granderson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Citi Field renovation No. 2, unveiled on Tuesday and limited to right-center field, should give a boost to hitters like David Wright, Lucas Duda and Curtis Granderson.
docs.abstract: New York Mets unveil new outfield fence that shortens distances in right-center field; change is intended to produce net advantage for team in home-run hitting, and was based on a careful analysis of balls hit at Citi Field in the previous season.

headline.print_headline: To Add Homers, the Mets Will Try a Little Subtraction

docs.snippet: On Tuesday, Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson unveiled the pitching-rich team’s latest attempt to win more games than it loses: It moved in the right-center-field fence....
docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson unveiled the pitching-rich team’s latest attempt to win more games than it loses: It moved in the right-center-field fence.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports Of The Times column expresses skepticism about plan by New York Mets to hit more home runs by moving right-center-field fence at Citi Field; holds that team should focus less on analytical gimmicks and more on serious problems like its misguided spending habits.

headline.seo: Mets' Biggest Off-Season Moves Involve the Fences These Days
headline.main: Fans May Like Home Runs, but They Love a Winner

docs.snippet: Shohei Otani has made waves in Japan by throwing strikes and smashing home runs for the Nippon Ham Fighters, but the 'Double Sworded Samurai' may have to give up one of his weapons if he is to realize his dream of making it big in Major League Bas...
docs.lead_paragraph: Shohei Otani has made waves in Japan by throwing strikes and smashing home runs for the Nippon Ham Fighters, but the 'Double Sworded Samurai' may have to give up one of his weapons if he is to realize his dream of making it big in Major League Baseball.

headline.main: Otani Cutting His Teeth in Japan but MLB Beckons

docs.abstract: Ken Takakura, who became a star playing outlaws and stoic heroes in scores of Japanese films, dies at age 83.

docs.snippet: The Miami Marlins completed the signing of slugging outfielder Giancarlo Stanton to a record 13-year, $325 million deal on Wednesday, the most lucrative player contract in U.S. professional sports history....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Miami Marlins completed the signing of slugging outfielder Giancarlo Stanton to a record 13-year, $325 million deal on Wednesday, the most lucrative player contract in U.S. professional sports history.
